alert.note: Alert for Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 7:55AM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Macon and Swain Counties. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM EST, Basin average rainfall for this event was 4 to 5 inches, and excessive runoff will continue throughout the Little Tennessee basin today. Above bankfull conditions, and flooding of low-lying areas near the river and select tributaries will linger into this afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Franklin, Fontana Lake, Burningtown, Cowee, Luada and Almond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
